### Section 1 - Variables & Mathematical Operators
This section discusses how to create variables and mathematical operations in R.
```{r}
x <- 10 # initialize numeric variable x
y <- 2  # initialize numeric variable y
summ <- x + y   # add two numeric variables
diff <- x - y   # difference two numeric variables
prod <- x * y   # product of two numeric variables
divi <- x / y   # dividing two numeric
square <- x ^ 2   # square of a numeric variable
cube <- x ^ 3   # cube of a numeric variable
sqroot <- x ^ 0.5 # square root of a numeric variable
cuberoot <- x ^ (1/3) # cube root of a numeric variable
intdiv = 10 %/% 3 # integer division of two variables
# Note - Integer division always returns the floor value. See examples below
negintdiv <- -8 %/% 3
modulo = 10 %% 3 # modulus of two variables
```
